alert.note: Alert for Swift (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 7:09PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SWIFT COUNTY THROUGH 745 PM CDT... At 709 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Correll, or 17 miles east of Ortonville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Appleton, Lake Oliver, and Appleton Airport. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 17 and 26. U.S. Highway 59 between mile markers 146 and 153. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Twin Cities.
